intro: Valeriana villarsii, commonly known as the Andean valerian, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, often pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, preferring cool and moist conditions. Its rhizomatous root system is notable for its medicinal properties, which have been traditionally used in herbal remedies. Valeriana villarsii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitats.
